parameters: \pop[2]Just as planned, the gang meets up in the private jet.
\pop[2]Everything was a bit more clear; but \c[14]far\c[0] from being set in stone.
\pop[2]Especially if we were planning to bring Kyron to the Wayfarer with us.
\pop[2]Just by default, places like that already had above average security.
\pop[2]But if Isaac really did pull this off, I guess there wouldn't be any issues.
\pop[2]The paranoia that others felt is slowly finding its place inside of me.
\pop[2]Kyron and Klace are sitting at one of the couches in the back.
\pop[2]They either beat us here, or they've been here all along.
\pop[2]For some reason, I'm surprised that they hit it off.
\pop[2]They exchange smiles, as they look down at Kyron's phone.
\pop[2]Klace must be showing him what he can do with his new device.
\pop[2]I bet it feels like a whole new world just opened up for him.
\pop[4]Wow, when you say it like that, I'm offended.
Taylor is the king of putting people on the spot.
\pop[3]Yeah, but the crown is just way too heavy, so I leave it at home.
Maybe you can come visit and take a look sometime.
\pop[3]He's also the king of flirting at the worst possible time.
Isn't that the best way to do it?
\pop[2]And suddenly, the gravity of the situation sets in.
\pop[2]No matter what, we were still aiding and abetting a \c[10]zero\c[0].
\pop[2]Would that really make our bond stronger? For some reason, I doubt it.
\pop[2]I \c[14]really\c[0] hope this has nothing to do with why they aren't in touch in their visions.
\pop[3]What were you two up to, anyway?
I hope we didn't intrude on anything.
\pop[4]He was just showing me some cool things I can do on my phone.
Why do you ask...? Is that a hint of jealousy I sense...?
\pop[3]No. I can do cool stuff on my phone, too.
Just didn't picture you two as... compatible.
\pop[4]He's pretty cool, actually. Even plays guitar.
I'm letting him listen to some of my music.
Not a fan of music made on a computer, I guess.
There's just something about the feel of those strings, y'know?
\pop[2]As the conversation continues, we all move to seats of our own.
\pop[2]Kyron really \c[14]is\c[0] just like one of us. I can't understand the logic of \c[23]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]It's not like Kyron chose to be born on a colony. It was forced upon him.
\pop[2]For example, if I left the city, I'd never be allowed to return.
\pop[2]And if I had children on the colony, they'd be stuck there too.
\pop[2]The choice to separate from \c[23]Argus\c[0] condemns your entire bloodline.
\pop[3]Well, more power to you two, then.
Maybe you'll get to feature on his next album.
\pop[4]And put an even bigger target on myself? No thanks.
I feel scared to even leave this plane. I'm working on it, though.
\pop[3]I hope you are, because I did some recon.
Looks like you'll be joining us at the tavern for sure~
Just have a couple hoops to jump through.
\pop[2]All of a sudden, I'm curious about what Isaac has to say.
\pop[2]Finalizing our tavern plans was the whole reason we came here, after all.
\pop[2]But now that he says Kyron can come too, I feel a bit more invigorated.
\pop[2]And it makes sense to me now, how him and Klace were able to bond.
\pop[2]He was scared to leave the plane, and Klace likes to hide away in here.
\pop[2]Both things seemed to add up perfectly to the sight placed before me.
\pop[3]Just another thing for the pile, I guess.
But we'll have to sneak Kyron in the back door.
I thought the whole point of this was for him to be \c[14]equal\c[0].
Now we're sneaking him in, like he doesn't even have an identity?
\pop[3]I will, but you have to stop cutting me off every single time.
I get that you're worried and confused, but you \c[14]need\c[0] to let me explain.
\pop[3]Well, it turns out the Wayfarer is running on outdated software.
I can only guarantee that my fix works if the place is up to date.
We could try, but honestly, it'd be pretty risky.
But don't you have experience with out of date tech?
\pop[2]That's true. His car was far from current.
\pop[4]I feel like they'd notice if a random guy just pops up.
Wouldn't we risk getting caught no matter what we do?
\pop[2]Isaac smirks, like he has everything figured out.
\pop[3]You know how sometimes they ID you a second time when you order drinks?
Those handheld scanners are always up to date. Maintained by \c[23]Argus\c[0].
So if we arouse any suspicion, Kyron should pass that check just fine.
\pop[2]That's true. It also doubles as a method of payment.
\pop[2]Dante held his phone up against one at the nightclub when we ordered tequila.
\pop[4]Kinda makes sense, when I think about it.
Didn't realize a version mismatch was that big of a deal.
\pop[3]It might not seem like it, but yeah.
What we have right now is basically a key.
I can't guarantee it'll work if they change the lock.
\pop[2]Everyone is silent, following through on their promise to let him speak.
\pop[2]Bypass the outdated tech, and get them to use a handheld scanner.
\pop[2]I looked up pictures of The Wayfarer, and "outdated" does seem to fit.
\pop[4]I'm cool with all of this if you are.
But what happens if the handheld scan doesn't work?
\pop[2]Kyron smirks, and lets out a soft laugh.
\pop[2]He scans the plane with his eyes, and looks content.
\pop[4]Well, at least I know exactly where to run to.
Thanks again, Isaac. For everything you've done.
Hopefully this is just the start of a new age.
Did you see the latest headlines? About \c[10]Hermes\c[0]...?
No one knows who they are, though.
Just a codename that seemed to stick.
\pop[3]They threatened \c[23]Argus\c[0]. Said they won't back down.
Apparently, they still want to get phones to all your friends.
They said it'd either be done by them, or by \c[23]Argus\c[0].
But if you can pull this off, I'm sure they can, too.
No offense, but I'd wager \c[10]Hermes\c[0] is smarter.
\pop[3]Well, I don't think it matters if they can or not.
If \c[23]Argus\c[0] doesn't step in, all of the \c[10]zeros\c[0] will starve and die.
Remember, due to our rules, this is a hunger strike, too.
\pop[3]And not only that, but \c[10]Cipher\c[0] would step in, publicly overpowering \c[23]Argus\c[0].
They have the chance to save lives, and their own public image.
All they have to do is make the right choice.
\pop[4]Let the \c[10]zeros\c[0] live in the city, you mean?
\pop[3]I don't see any other option for the people in power.
It seems like a total checkmate, doesn't it?
\pop[4]Lose to a mysterious rebel organization, or let innocent people die?
If I were \c[23]Argus\c[0], I think I'd know exactly what to do. Pride isn't always worth the price.
\pop[3]Well, \c[23]Argus\c[0] is so mysterious, we have no idea what they're thinking.
If this is when they show their true colors, I just hope we like what we see.
\pop[4]Yeah, those protests seem to be getting pretty heated.
I'd hate if they escalated into violence, and people got hurt.
Do you think \c[23]Argus\c[0] might force them out of the city?
\pop[3]I doubt it. Remember, the spotlight is on them now.
Every move they make will be scrutinized as much as possible.
It really looks like we might be moving toward unity for once.
\pop[2]He looks over at Kyron, and smirks.
\pop[3]And in that case, we didn't do anything wrong.
We were just... ahead of the curve.
We could see the tensions mounting right in front of us.
Let's just hope that \c[23]Argus\c[0] wants to negotiate and compromise.
\pop[4]Looks like it'll be an interesting couple weeks, then.
Happy to be part of the gang, and have front-row seats.
And if the world goes down, at least we all go down together.
\pop[3]Of course he tunes in at the first mention of getting down.
\pop[2]A small laugh between friends ensues, as everything seems a bit better.
\pop[2]I'm a bit scared, since we seem to be on the verge of big societal change.
\pop[2]But the uncertainty of what that change is, starts to terrify me.
\pop[2]I'd like to believe that \c[23]Argus\c[0] is good, and they'll compromise with the \c[10]zeros\c[0].
\pop[2]However, we hardly know anything about them. Just that they're kind of in charge.
\pop[2]This is their chance to step in, and show the world who they really are.
\pop[2]And by extension, seal our own fates as well...
\pop[3]Well, we have our game plan for the weekend.
Let's say we meet at The Wayfarer after supper on Friday?
\pop[4]Works for me. Kinda excited to see what this place is like.
I'll meet you nearby, and we can work on sneaking me in.
\pop[3]And only a few days later, it's time for The Quantum Leap.
\pop[4]Oh, yeah. They mentioned that the other day.
I never did get an explanation on what it is.
You know how midnight is the best part of New Year's Eve?
Well, we rig a few clocks so we get to do it four times in one night.
Will Kyron be able to come...?
\pop[3]I'm not so sure about that right now.
Let's see how things go at The Wayfarer?
Wouldn't want to be a thorn in anyone's side.
But I \c[14]do\c[0] have one question. Could you take me to the Triple R?
\pop[2]We all exchange glances, before directing our eyes toward Isaac.
\pop[3]It's current. Shouldn't be a problem at all.
How about we meet there tomorrow?
\pop[4]Sure thing. It'll be our first group outing.
Let's just hope that nothing goes wrong.
\pop[2]Taylor holds up his hand, like he's raising an invisible shot glass.
\pop[3]Here's to... living life on the edge...?
\pop[2]Kyron smirks, raising his hand up as well.
